intro: Hieracium podospermum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale yellow to brown ray florets. Hieracium podospermum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
